**Laboratory Proficiency Testing Program Services**
==============================================

**Reference Number:** 5000075697
**Publication Date:** 2023-10-17
**Closing Date:** 2023-11-01T14:00:00

**Background**
---------------

Environment and Climate Change Canada is seeking a contractor to provide laboratory proficiency testing (LPT) program services for its science and technology laboratories. The program aims to ensure the laboratories meet ISO/IEC 17025 quality standards by participating in proficiency testing programs.

**Scope of Work**
-------------------

The contractor will provide LPT samples and complete services associated with the program, including:

* Four studies per year for the National Laboratory for Environmental Testing (NLET) in Burlington, Ontario
* Two studies per year for NLET Saskatoon, Saskatchewan
* Written final reports with performance evaluations against other laboratories

**Contract Period**
-------------------------

The proposed contract period is from the contract award date to October 31, 2026.

**Estimated Contract Value**
---------------------------

The estimated contract value is $57,000 (tax extra).

**Pre-identified Supplier**
-------------------------

The pre-identified supplier is Proficiency Testing Canada Inc.

**Statement of Capabilities**
---------------------------

Interested suppliers must submit a statement of capabilities demonstrating their ability to meet the requirements outlined in the specification. This includes:

* Providing a proficiency test program that meets international standards (ISO/IEC 17043:2010)
* Reporting performance evaluations against other laboratories

**Trade Agreements**
----------------------

This procurement is not subject to trade agreements.

**Set-Aside Under the Procurement Strategy for Aboriginal Business**
-------------------------------------------------------------------

This procurement is not subject to a set-aside under the Procurement Strategy for Aboriginal Business.

**Comprehensive Land Claims Agreement**
-----------------------------------------

This procurement is not subject to the Comprehensive Land Claims Agreement.

**Procurement Method**
----------------------

The procurement method is an Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN), allowing other suppliers to signal their interest in bidding.

**Contact Information**
-----------------------

For more information and to submit a statement of capabilities, please contact:

* Megan Filliol (megan.filliol@ec.gc.ca) at Environment and Climate Change Canada.

**Attachments**
----------------

The tender notice and contract documents can be downloaded from [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/22393/5000075697_acan_pt-test_en_final_0.pdf](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform
